entry.title: WebCodecs decode error for valid H.264 when using D3D11 HW decoder
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Unzip the attached example and host it via HTTPS 2. Open the attached example, and open DevTools 3. Click "Play" 4. In DevTools, observe the error "Uncaught DOMException: Decoding error." 5. In the Media Tab in Dev Tools observe the error:
Error Group: DecoderStatus Error Code: 1 Stacktrace: media\gpu\windows\d3d11_video_decoder.cc:1064 Caused by: Error Group: D3D11Status Error Code: 6 Data: VDA Error: 0 Stacktrace: media\gpu\windows\d3d11_video_decoder.cc:762
6. In the JS code, uncomment the line to prefer-software (line 46) and retry the sample 7. Observe playback works OK with the software decoder
# Problem Description Attempting to decode a valid GOP of H.264 (generated by NVENC) using the HW decoder (D3D11) results in an error. Uncaught DOMException: Decoding error.
The bitstream appears to be correct, and plays OK via MPEG DASH, or when via WebCodecs when preferring SW decoder.
# Additional Comments Same problem exists in other Chromium browsers. Firefox doesn't support WebCodecs. I cannot test Safari as I don't have a Mac.
# Summary WebCodecs decode error for valid H.264 when using D3D11 HW decoder
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Media
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Record the number of auto-revoked permissions per type
entry.content: On each run of auto-revocation record the number of revoked permissions per permission type.

entry.title: Graphite initialize failed if monitored fence is not supported on Windows
entry.content: Some old GPU drivers don't support monitored fecne, so ID3D11Fence cannot be created. We need to figure out a way to support those devices

entry.title: Suggest password available to non syncing users
entry.content:
Create a new chrome profile associated with a google account. Make sure the account doesn't have any saved passwords and that the account is not syncing. (not sure, but maybe the bug reproduces also if the account has saved passwords).
Go to https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/ and right click on the password field. Wait a few minutes and then right click again. "Suggest password" is now displayed in the context menu.
Proof: [video](http://go/scrcast/NjY0MzU5NzA2NjYzMzIxNnwwMjczZDg1YS1hNQ).

entry.title: whatsapp not working
entry.content:
This template is for filing bugs against Android System WebView. Chrome bugs should be filed at https://crbug.com/wizard.
Android device name:
Android OS version:
Android System WebView version: (Settings > Apps > the 3 dots in the upper right > Show system. On Android N (7.x) through P (9.0), please include Chrome's version. Otherwise, look for "Android System WebView")
Application: (package name or Play Store URL)
Application version:
Steps to reproduce:
1. 2. 3.
Expected result:
Actual result:
Did this work before? (last working WebView version, or N/A)
---
It's especially helpful if you can capture a bug report right after you experience the bug, and attach it here. See https://developer.android.com/studio/debug/bug-report for instructions.
Screen recordings can also be very helpful - see https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line/adb#screenrecord. Please enable "Show taps" in developer settings.

entry.title: Password manager fills into ZIP code field, defeats Autofill
entry.content:
When trying to register on https://www.reservecalifornia.com/Web/Customers/NewCustomer.aspx, PWM fills (a prefix of) the username into the ZIP code field.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Start a booking on https://www.reservecalifornia.com/ 2. When asked to login, enter a username and a password. (I did this not realizing that it's a login, not a signup form.) 3. Start registering at https://www.reservecalifornia.com/Web/Customers/NewCustomer.aspx. On page load, the ZIP code field is filled by PWM.
I guess PWM is the right component, but ccing Autofill people as fyi.
chrome://{autofill,password-manager}-internals is attached.

entry.title: Render pass backings as buffer queue for delegated overlays
entry.content: It should be noted that it is not always possible to have a render pass itself represented as an overlay the reason for this is that there are some operations like blurs that need to take place in another buffer.

entry.title: Page submits on autofill, import offered
entry.content:
When I autofilled the form https://www.reservecalifornia.com/Web/Customers/NewCustomer.aspx Chrome immediately asks me whether I want to save the filled address. Two things aren't great about this:
1. Intuitively, the filled address and the import candidate should be equivalent. Why am I getting asked for an import? 2. I just autofilled a form and don't want to think about import.
I suspect the second point is because the site is doing strange things. I haven't checked which kind of submission happens. Maybe we need to change the submission detection. I was on Canary, so maybe it's related to the submission experiments.
Assigning to Jihad for further analysis. Maybe issue 1 and 2 should be two separate bugs.
chrome://autofill-internals is attached.

# Summary Chrome 124.0.6367.61 causes crash with V15 angualr material basic mat-select
# Custom Questions #### How much crashed? Just one tab
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
# Additional Data Category: Crashes \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Getting error in Netflix while doing Backward or Forward using Control your music,video and more option
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 126.0.6425.0 (Official Build) canary (x86_64) 0a403b76339c11c83b10d777be891e117856085c-refs/branch-heads/6425@%7B#1}
OS: Mac,Win and Linux
Steps: 1. Launch chrome and open NTP 2. Go to “https://www.netflix.com/in/” and sign in 3. Start play any video 4. Once video started click on “control your music,videos and more” option near Google account icon 5. Try to forward or backward the video by using “seek forward” or “seek backward” option 6. Observe that while doing backward/forward netflix throwing error message “Sorry, We’re having trouble with your request‘ with error code
Actual: In “control your music,videos and more” backward/forward mode is not working
Expected: In “control your music,videos and more” backward/forward should work properly
The feature is implemented from M125 build #125.0.6386.0 and its not working from #125.0.6386.0 So raising it as Non-Regression issue.
Please find the attached screencast for reference. 125.0.6385.0: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dzgk7lVLnViX9Fmgl07ojH1u-nIjxbOk/view?usp=sharing 125.0.6386.0: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wtU5mACp2rKA5_gzDFHtM62OykE6CkVp/view?usp=sharing
Note: Issue is unable to repro on Stable #123.0.6312.124 Issue is repro on Beta #125.0.6422.4 and Dev #125.0.6420.4
Thanks

entry.title: Chrome Should not show search engine selector
entry.content:
Seems like on some machines `--enable-field-trial-config` enables the search engine slector, `--enable-field-trial-config --disable-search-engine-choice-screen` doesn't have it
This cannot be reproduced on the workstations or my macbook in switzerland. Some macbooks in the EU (germany) do show it.
For go/crossbench we do run with `--no-first-run` which should likely disable this behavior. For now I'm going to add `--disable-search-engine-choice-screen` to the default flag list so we can unblock us.

entry.title: [FedCM] Auto login modal can't be close by clicking x icon
entry.content:
New FedCM modal can't be close by clicking x icon. Method from prompt notification isSkippedMoment() is not retuned it that case. Login in and skipping modal by clicking x return the same dismiss status with credential_returned value
Expected: Clicking x button on FedCM auto login should return isSkippedMoment() callback

entry.title: Failing test on glinux
entry.content: ``` FAILED crossbench/benchmarks/experimental/power/analysis/power_result_parser_test.py::PowerParserTest::test_avg_power_calculation_from_input_files_correctly FAILED tests/end2end/browser/chrome/test_downloader.py::test_download_pre_115_canary FAILED tests/end2end/browser/chrome/test_downloader.py::test_download_specific_version_pre_115_stable ```

entry.title: Consider warning message when 103 Early Hint sent on subresource
entry.content:
https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40222701 added 103 Early Hints support to DevTools and shows these headers.
Currently Chrome (and other browsers) [limit 103 Early Hints support to the main navigation resource](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/web-platform/early-hints#current_limitations) and do not support this on sub-resources.
But DevTools will show any 103 Early Hints headers sent on sub resources (see attached picture). We think that is the right thing to so but, maybe we should add a warning that they will be ignored?
Example URL where you can see this: https://www.tunetheweb.com/experiments/early-hints/

entry.title: Feature Request - Table Headers Split Across PDF Page to Have Different Header Text
entry.content:
Hi,
I wanted to request a feature to be able to change a table with CSS when a table is split across pdf pages. For example, if a table is split across pages 1 and 2 of a pdf and the first page `thead th` has the text 'Reviews', I would like `thead th` on the second page to have the text 'Reviews continued'.
I tried using CSS to solve this problem by doing `:not(:first-child)`, but it seems that there is only one `thead` in the pdf, even though two are displayed.

entry.title: Tab titles and bookmark bar are using a bold font
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open a new tab 2. Look at the bookmarks bar/the tab title
# Problem Description Recently the font of the tab titles/bookmarks bar has become bold, I assume this is unintentional because it's harder to read entirely bold text
# Summary Tab titles and bookmark bar are using a bold font
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: PiP video can't be seen in Mac full screen
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 126.0.6425.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) 0a403b76339c11c83b10d777be891e117856085c-refs/branch-heads/6425@{#1}
OS : Mac Arm (14.3 beta, 13.5 Beta, 11.4,13.4), Mac Intel(10.15.7)
** Prerequisites (flags on/off) - None
Steps to reproduce : 1. Launch Chrome and play any YouTube video 2. Click on the symbol which appears in the omnibox 3. Click on Enter picture-in-picture 4. Enter full screen and repeat the same steps 5. Observe that PiP video can't be seen
Observed results: PiP video can't be seen in Mac full screen
Expected Result : PiP video must be seen in Mac full screen
Number of times you were able to reproduce: 5/5 - Yes Bug reproducible after clean install: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible after clearing cache and cookies: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Arm64 Macs: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Intel Macs: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Chrome for Windows or Linux: No Bug reproducible on Safari/Firefox (When the issue is in Web Content): Firefox: No Bug reproducible on current stable build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Stable #122.0.6261.112 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current beta channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Beta #123.0.6312.28 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current Dev channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Dev #124.0.6329.0 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current Canary channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Canary #124.0.6355.0 Mac OS :Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4)
This issue exists from M-114 onwards. So Raising it as a NR Issue.
Since, this is a Non-Regression Issue, setting the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Attaching screencast for reference.
Note: 1. Issue able to repro on latest Canary #126.0.6425.0 ,Dev #125.0.6420.4, Beta #125.0.6422.4, and Stable #124.0.6367.61 2. Issue not repro on Win(10,11) and Linux
Thank You..!!

entry.title: Fractional scaling under 100% on Wayland makes any chromium-based app behave wrong
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Apply scaling to a monitor with a value under 100% (80% for example) 2. Open any chromium-based application on a wayland session 3. The application can't be interacted with in an expected way
# Problem Description When on a monitor with a scaling lower than 100%, the window of the application will render wrong, with the visible border of the window being in a different possition than the actual border. Al interaction with the window doesn't work as expected, with buttons or any clickable part being visually misplaced compared to the actual window. The issue only applies on scaled down monitors, when the window is placed on a >100% display, it behaves as expected.
# Summary Fractional scaling under 100% on Wayland makes any chromium-based app behave wrong
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: No

entry.title: Fix RTL in TabStrip
Align with cookieEnabled spec in 3p contexts

entry.title: GWP-ASan: control parameters at process granularity
entry.content:
On a [recent (Google-internal) thread, we found that browser processes on Mac hit GWP-ASan exhaustion quite a lot](https://groups.google.com/a/google.com/g/chrome-memory-tok/c/ixQeTMwpP5w/m/FrUI2rRlAAAJ). Basically everything else outside this specific combination is fine.
The agreement we reached was to vary parameters by process. We need to address the browser process specifically, but the others may also have different allocation patterns that call for different parameters.
Side note: the exhaustion histograms tell us that Mac browser processes are hitting exhaustion relatively _early_. This suggests an early burst of long-lived allocations. I think we could introduce a parameterized delay (independent of the sampling rate etc.) to get around this.

entry.title: Investigate which browserState to load at startup
No depth indicator scrollbar seen when scrolling with the keyboard
entry.content: Chrome 124. 1. Choose any webpage. To keep things reproducible, say chrome://version/ . 2. OK, now scroll down, using two fingers on the trackpad. On the right margin the scrollbar appers, letting us know how deep we are in the file. 3. Now instead scroll down via holding down the keyboard down arrow key. No scrollbar appears. When we hit the bottom of the file "the elevator comes to a sudden halt and the people have to look outside (check by using the trackpad to scroll) to see what happened -- Oh, we're at the bottom floor."

entry.title: Cannot intermix trackpad and keyboard scrolling
entry.content:
Chrome 124. Today we open the Chrome browser on a Chromebook. 1. Let's choose any webpage. To keep things reproducible, say chrome://version/ . 2. OK, now scroll down, using two fingers on the trackpad. 3. As is our habit, we sometimes also scroll using the keyboard down arrow button. Do that. 4. Whammo! The page rolls back up like one of those old fashioned window shades, at 60 miles per hour. Our reading position is lost forever, and we are now back staring at the top of the file.
Proof that the Chrome team is doing things wrong: Scrolling using the keyboard first and then switching to the trackpad respects positions. But doing it in the opposite order does not!
